summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from July 2020. Mark L. Epstein forwards a threatening email to the FBI, claiming his email has been hacked. The forwarded chain contains vague, accusatory statements about Mark Epstein's character and alleged contact with underage girls, referencing his brother Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Mark L. Epstein contacted the FBI in July 2020 to report that his email had been hacked and to forward a threatening message.
The threatening email accused Mark Epstein of being 'very interested in women' and having 'been in contact with underage girls.'
The email referenced Jeffrey Epstein's wealth and stated that Mark's access to it was limited ('He no longer has much time to use his brother's wealth').
The email chain suggests ongoing harassment or attempts at extortion ('I was going to take some money from him and give it back to him later.') targeting Mark Epstein after his brother's death.
